intro: Catoferia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas catoferia, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
